stem: A 72-year-old client with a history of heart failure is undergoing a Massive Transfusion Protocol (MTP) for a GI bleed. Based on the documentation in the MTP & Pulmonary Surveillance Log, what is the most appropriate nursing intervention?

tabs.title: MTP Infusion Record
tabs.content:
Units Given: Unit #8 (PRBC) just completed.
Rate: Rapid infusion device (Level 1) used.
Total Volume: 3,200 mL IV fluids and blood in last 2 hours.

tabs.title: Respiratory Assessment
tabs.content:
IndicatorPre-MTPCurrent (After Unit 8)
Lung SoundsClearFrequent Crackles (Bibasilar)
Venous Pressure (CVP)4 mmHg18 mmHg (High)
BP90/54168/98
Heart Rate110116 (S3 heart sound present)

options.text: Postpone any further blood units and administer IV Furosemide (Lasix)
Increase the infusion rate to reach a goal BP of 180 systolic
Administer IV Epinephrine to treat an suspected anaphylactic reaction
Prepare for emergent intubation due to suspected TRALI reaction

rationale.correct: The client is experiencing **Transfusion-Associated Circulatory Overload (TACO) (a1)**. Key indicators are the extremely high CVP (18), the sudden hypertension (168/98), the S3 heart sound, and the massive spike in BNP (from 400 to 4200). In a patient with pre-existing heart failure, the rapid volume expansion from MTP has caused the heart to 'fail forward,' leading to pulmonary edema. The priority is to stop the volume and remove the excess fluid with a diuretic like Furosemide.
clinicalPearls: TACO = Hypertension + High CVP + High BNP. (Volume problem).
TRALI = Hypotension + Normal CVP + Fever. (Lung injury problem).
MTP is life-saving but carries a high risk of TACO in patients with cardiac or renal history.

questionTrap.trap: Choosing TRALI (a4) because the lungs have crackles.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Check the Blood Pressure! TRALI causes low BP (distributive components). TACO causes high BP (too much volume in the pipes). Also, the S3 and BNP are specific to heart failure/overload.

mnemonic.title: TACO Tall
mnemonic.expansion: T-Tension (High BP). A-Added S3 sound. C-CVP is high. O-Overload (Crackles).
